raw_comment:
I noticed that legacy's with parents who have high income rates are more likely to be admitted. 

I also noticed that the 10th percentile of non legacy has a higher chance than the 90th, which is richer.

I wonder why that is and what it says about admissions.
ace_sentences: Some parents have a high income.
Legacy applicants with parents who have a high income are more likely to be admitted.
Some non-legacy applicants are in the 10th income percentile.
Some non-legacy applicants are in the 90th income percentile.
The 10th income percentile of non-legacy applicants has a higher chance of admission than the 90th income percentile of non-legacy applicants.
The 90th income percentile is richer than the 10th income percentile.
I wonder why this difference exists.
I wonder what this difference says about admissions.
